noun.description: A point at which lines or pathways intersect or branch; a central or connecting point.
examples: the intersections of two or more such arteries would clearly become major nodes of traffic and urban activity

noun.description: The part of a plant stem from which one or more leaves emerge, often forming a slight swelling or knob.
examples: the stem is cut midway between nodes

noun.description: A lymph node or other structure consisting of a small mass of differentiated tissue.
examples: infection in these nodes may lead to backache

noun.description: A point at which the amplitude of vibration in a standing wave system is zero.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a knotty swelling or a protuberance): from Latin nodus knot.
